content.content: IPFS/Filecoin has been the go-to decentralized file storage provider for years. While Filecoin launched its own independent blockchain, a competing provider, Swarm, is closely integrated with Ethereum. For example, Swarm’s token BZZ is backed by DAI. The PSM is now available on the Swarm network. Tested an approval and exchange. Also, the Swarm-based video hosting site Etherna will host Devcon videos this year.

Awesome to see Swarm growing. If Maker acted intelligently it would greatly reward integrations like this, for instance with a grant to run more decentralized front ends or collateral onboarding. The same goes for the relationship with Gnosis – they’ve been there for us, are we there for them now that they’ve applied for a Vault? Dai’s integrations are the only reason it continues to have market share. We should ignore this at our own peril.

g_dip:  If Maker acted intelligently it would greatly reward integrations like this, for instance with a grant to run more decentralized front ends or collateral onboarding.   @psychonaut nice post Josh! @g_dip I actually brought up this topic during today’s G&R call–on how this protocol has not taken the necessary steps to decentralized some of the front-ends, including this here Forum & Discord–when we have ecosystem players out there like Ceramic, Akash, Arweave, and as mentioned here, Swarm. However, I am hopeful that IF the Endgame does get approved by MKR token owners–such necessity will finally come into fruition, and some of these platforms/protocols will be Ecosystem Actors that will be bidding to build front-ends for MetaDAOs. This process of cross-building, buying & selling between organizational units already exists in the real-world.

flipflopflapdelegate:  IF the Endgame does get approved by MKR token owners–such necessity will finally come into fruition   EndGame or not, we are working on decentralized front ends. EndGame should not be viewed as a monolithic plan, but as a conglomeration of elements can be pursued independently.
